content: The Act may be cited as the "Alien Smuggling and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2007". Congress recognizes that alien smuggling is a transnational crime that threatens the integrity of US borders, sovereignty, and national security. Enforcement efforts against alien smuggling are crucial to protect the country, with special recognition given to the Department of Homeland Security and the US Border Patrol. The law enforcement community, including the Department of Homeland Security and the Department of Justice, must have the necessary statutory tools to address the security threat posed by alien smuggling. Laws regarding failure to heave to are also insufficient in penalizing boat operators and crew involved in reckless transportation of aliens on the high seas.
